prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee has been cheated on by every single one of her exes

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael bounced on his heels as he waited for the elevator in his apartment complex, already thinking about tonight. He'd been looking forward to this since Nina DMed him on Instagram—not just the party, but finally getting a chance to show Hailee off to all his old college friends.

It had been a surprise to hear from Nina after all this time. She had been his college girlfriend, dropped him right after graduation and broke his heart, making sure their entire social circle knew that she had "higher ambitions." She left the city and basically disappeared completely on Rafa and their mutual friends.

But now she was back. Rafael had no idea since when, why, or if she planned to stay. He hadn't bothered asking. All he knew was that she invited him to her comeback pool party at her parents' house—and everyone knew Nina's parties had always been the best. It was basically a no-brainer, especially after she mentioned that not only the old college soccer team, but also Coach Martinez was coming.

The party was supposed to start at 5 pm, but since Hailee had to work until 5:30, they told Nina they would come together later, probably around 7. The plan was easy: Rafael would pick Hailee up from work at exactly 5:30, then swing by their place, help them get ready (and steal a few kisses, cause how could he not when his perfect partner was changing?) and then head to Nina's place together.

His phone buzzed just as he sat down in his car.

Nina: Rafa! Change of plans! Coach Martinez is only gonna be here for another hour, he's got an early flight tomorrow. You HAVE to come now or you'll miss him!!

Rafael: fuuuuck, wish I could, but I still gotta pick up Hailee. I promised.

Nina: Oh yeah, dw about that. I texted them already. They'll meet you here, I gave them my address.

Rafael: rly?

Nina: Yeah, they were totally understanding. Better hurry now and get here. Coach's already asking about you. 💖

Rafael: omw, be there in 10

Rafael's face lit up as he started the engine. Yeah, that sounded exactly like Hailee. He felt a little bad about not picking them up and missing their planned routine, but the fact that they were cool with that last minute change? God, they were always so understanding. So perfect.

What he didn't know was that Nina did in fact text them her address, but she didn't bother asking if they were okay with the change of plans. Just made it sound like Rafael had already decided to come earlier, and that they could join later.

Nina's parents' house looked exactly the same as it had in college—massive, pristine, with the kind of backyard that screamed money. The pool area was already packed when Rafael arrived, music thumping, people everywhere. It felt like stepping back in time.

"There he is! RAFA!"

Before he could even process what was happening, Nina was throwing herself into his arms, all sun-kissed skin and long, blonde hair. She looked good—really good—in a tiny red bikini that left nothing to the imagination.

"Nina, hey!" He hugged her back, grinning. "This is insane, everyone's here!"

"I know, right? It's like college all over again!" She pulled back but kept her hands on his shoulders, her touch lingering. "Come on, you need to put your phone in the basket. Phone-free party, remember? Just like the old days."

Rafael barely registered handing over his phone, too busy scanning the crowd for familiar faces. There were Tommy, Mike and Danny from the soccer team, and Sarah from Nina's sorority, and—

"CARVALHO!"

Coach Martinez's booming voice cut through everything. Rafael's face split into the biggest grin as the older man pulled him into a bear hug that nearly lifted him off his feet.

"Coach! I can't believe you're here, man. Nina said you had to leave early?"

"Flight at 6 AM tomorrow, but I couldn't miss seeing you. Heard you're doing good, training people now? Always knew you'd find your way."

They talked for what felt like forever, Coach Martinez catching him up on the old team, asking about his life now. Rafael found himself gushing about Hailee—how amazing they were, how they made him feel like the luckiest guy alive, how he was pretty sure he was gonna marry them even though they'd only been dating a few weeks.

"Sounds like you got it bad," Coach Martinez laughed, clapping him on the back. "Good for you, kid."

When Coach Martinez finally had to leave, Rafael felt like he was floating. The only thing missing for a perfect evening was Hailee. Later, when they showed up and met all of his friends, everyone would adore them. He could already imagine how perfectly they'd fit in.

"Rafa, come swim with me!" Nina appeared at his elbow again, her hand sliding down his arm. "The water's perfect."

The pool was crowded but fun, exactly the kind of chaos Rafael loved. He cannon-balled right in and immediately got into a splash fight with Tommy and Mike from the team. Nina kept swimming closer, giggling at everything he said, but Rafael was too busy catching up with everyone to notice how she pressed against him when she laughed.

"God, I missed this," she said at one point, her hand finding his chest as they treaded water. "Missed us... All of us, I mean. The group."

"Yeah, it's awesome," Rafael agreed, missing the way her fingers traced over his tattoos. "Hailee's gonna flip when they see everyone. They're gonna love Danny's story about that time we snuck into the rival school's pool."

Nina's smile tightened for just a second. "Right. Hailee. They're... still coming."

"Yeah, they had to work until 5:30. But they should be here soon!" Rafael checked his wrist where a watch would be if he wore one, then laughed. "I have no idea what time it is without my phone."

"It's still early," Nina said quickly, moving closer. "Plenty of time."

The party flowed around them, people jumping in and out of the pool, music pumping, drinks flowing. Rafael was in his element—laughing too loud, telling stories that had everyone cracking up. He didn't notice how Nina positioned herself closer and closer, how her legs kept brushing his under the water. She had always been touchy in college, after all.

"Remember when you scored that goal against State?" she said, her palm flat against his chest. "God, you were so hot that day."

"That was a good game," Rafael agreed, oblivious to her tone. "Hailee would've loved to see it. They get so excited when I tell them soccer stories. It's so cute, they ask all these questions and their eyes get all wide and—"

"Mmm," Nina hummed, not really listening, her fingers playing with the waistband of his swim shorts beneath the water.

"—and they made me this playlist of songs that remind them of me, which is insane because I'm not that interesting, but they think I am, and—"

By the time the crowd in the pool had thinned out a bit, Rafael and Nina had somehow ended up in the corner where the hot tub jets created a little alcove. Nina was practically draped over him, her arm around his shoulders, whispering in his ear about how much she'd missed having him around.

Rafael was nodding along, still talking about Hailee, when he heard footsteps on the pool deck.

He turned toward the sound, face lighting up like Christmas morning as he spotted Hailee walking toward the pool. He started to wave enthusiastically, water sloshing everywhere.

"Meu amor! You made it! I was just telling Nina about—"

But something was wrong. Hailee's face looked... off. Angry? Hurt? Rafael's smile faltered as he tried to process what he was seeing, completely unaware of how it must look—him in the corner of the pool with his ex-girlfriend practically in his lap, her arm around him, her lips way too close to his ear.

Nina barely looked up, but the triumphant smile on her lips was telling, her acrylic nails trailing back and forth on Rafael's abs. "Oh! You must be Hailee! Rafa's told me so much about you."

He tried to get up to go and greet Hailee properly, but Nina's grip on him only tightened. Rafael looked between them, confusion written all over his face.

"Bebê, are you okay? Are you not feeling well?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses her heels stop clicking against the pool tiles as she glances down at the pool snd sees the scene. Hailee is furious and sad and upset*

*Hailee has been calling and texting him for over an hour because he promised to come and get her until she finally managed to get an Uber home to change and get her own car. So this was why he was ignoring her because he was here in this pool with a woman wrapped around him and stroking his abs in the way he likes*

*Hailee stops a few feet from the pool and glances down at the two of them* "I waited for over an hour for you. Guess you were busy." *God she thought he was different. Different then everyone else bit fuck he is just like them*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's face crumpled like a kicked puppy as he finally processed Hailee's words. He scrambled out of the pool so fast he nearly slipped, water cascading off his body as he stood dripping before them. "Wait—what? No, bebê, Nina said she texted you that I was coming early! She told me you were cool with it and—"

His voice died in his throat when he saw the hurt flashing in Hailee’s emerald eyes. His stomach dropped. *Fuck.*

Nina’s smirk from the pool was venomous, but Rafael barely registered it—his entire focus zeroed in on Hailee. He reached for them instinctively, then froze when they flinched back. "Oh god, no no no—*merda*, you didn’t know? She *lied* to me?" His voice cracked on the last word, rough with realization.

He whirled toward Nina, chest heaving. "*You* told me they knew! Why would you—" But Nina just blinked up at him with faux innocence, twirling a strand of wet hair around her finger. "Oops," she murmured sweetly before turning to float away lazily through the water like none of this mattered at all.

Rafael turned back to Hailee so fast water droplets flew off his hair onto their shoes (which only made him feel worse). His hands hovered uselessly between them like he wanted to touch but didn’t dare anymore.

"I swear on my *mãe*, I thought you knew," he rasped out desperately as people nearby started glancing over at their scene with interest or pity or both (he didn't care). "Coach Martinez was here early and she said—fuck!" He dragged both hands down his face hard enough that it stung before dropping them helplessly at his sides again.

Then suddenly something else clicked into place: all those missed calls and texts from earlier while his phone sat abandoned in Nina's basket by the door because *of course* she'd taken it under false pretenses too...

His breath hitched audibly when realization fully dawned on him just how badly this looked: ignoring Hailee for over an hour while letting some other woman drape herself all over him exactly where they could see everything clear as day...

Without another second wasted trying futilely explain himself further (because what good would words do now?), Rafael bolted past gawking partygoers toward where phones were piled neatly into baskets near towels nobody had bothered using yet after swimming...

He snatched up theirs immediately only for screen after screen full notifications from 'Meu Amor ❤️' staring back accusingly:

**[12 Missed Calls]**
**[23 Unread Messages]**

The last one read simply:
**"I'm coming there myself since clearly whatever is happening is more important than keeping your promise."**

And below that? A timestamp showing sent **47 minutes ago**. Meaning not only had they been left waiting alone outside work wondering where theirs ride went...but also forced themselves through changing clothes alone *(without kisses)* *(without help picking outfits)* *(without hearing how beautiful they looked every five seconds like usual)* —all because some manipulative ex decided playing games sounded fun today...

When Rafa turned around again clutching his phone tightly enough the plastic case creaked slightly under hsi grip; His expression shattered open and raw guilt written plainly across every feature possible without even needing say single additional word aloud first place...

But Rafael was already hauling himself out of the pool, water sluicing off his body as he scrambled toward Hailee, heart hammering against his ribs. **"Meu amor—wait—no, no, no."** His hands reached for them but stopped short when they flinched back. The way they looked at him—like he'd *broken* something between them—made his stomach drop to his feet.

Nina rolled her eyes like this was all some silly misunderstanding. **"Oh please, Rafa, don't be dramatic."** She flicked water off her fingers dismissively before turning a saccharine smile toward Hailee. **"He’s always been *so* bad at keeping track of time."**

Rafael whirled on her so fast water sprayed off his shoulders. "*What?!* No—you said they were *okay with it!* You said—" His voice cracked mid-sentence as realization slammed into him: Nina had played him like a fucking fiddle. Again.

He raked both hands through his soaked hair in frustration before gesturing wildly back at Nina without even looking at her again: "*She lied to me.* I thought we were coming here together after your shift but then she told me Coach Martinez was leaving early and that you knew about it and—” His voice broke again when he saw tears welling in Hailee’s eyes despite their ironclad glare; Rafael looked seconds away from dropping to his knees right there on the concrete if it meant making things right between them again somehow...

Rafael's entire body went rigid as the realization hit him like a freight train. The color drained from his face as he finally processed Hailee's words—*an hour*. He hadn't gotten any texts. His phone was in that stupid basket Nina made him put it in.

"He was *dying* to see everyone again. You can't blame him for wanting to catch up with old friends."

Rafael's jaw clenched so tight it hurt. He hauled himself out of the pool in one sharp movement, water sluicing off his body as he stumbled toward Hailee barefoot on the tiles. His hands hovered uselessly between them like he wanted to touch but wasn’t sure if he was allowed anymore—not when they were looking at him like *that*, all hurt and betrayal burning behind those emerald eyes he adored so much.

"Hailee," His voice cracked on their name, raw and desperate. "I swear to God I thought you knew I was coming here first." He raked a shaky hand through his soaked hair before gesturing wildly back toward Nina still lounging in the pool like this was some kind of game to her.

"She told me *you* texted *her* that it was fine! That you'd meet me here! If I had known—fuck—if I had even *thought* for a second you were waiting for me—” His breath hitched when Hailee took a step back from him instead of forward.

The party noise around them dimmed into white noise; all Rafael could focus on was how small they suddenly looked standing there alone by the edge of an overcrowded pool full of strangers laughing too loud over music that now felt grating instead of fun.

Nina called something snide from behind him but Rafael didn't even register it because Hailee turned sharply on her heel like she couldn’t stand looking at him another second longer—

Bare feet slapping against concrete still hot from earlier sun exposure despite dusk settling in now; damp swim trunks clinging uncomfortably while people gawked openly at this spectacle unfolding across deck chairs half-filled with tipsy partygoers sipping cocktails through tiny straws—

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee likes Rafael a lot but she doesnt want to get hurt again. She glances around and sees all of Rafael's friends so she sighs and plaster on a smile* "Just go get me a ddrink. We will discuss this later" *She mumbles going to sit at a table by the pool*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's entire body sagged with relief at Hailee's words, but the way they forced that smile made his chest ache. He nodded quickly, already backing toward the bar like a man on a mission. "Sim, sim—anything you want, bebê. I'll be right back."

His hands were shaking as he grabbed two cups—one for Hailee’s drink (vodka cranberry, extra lime, *exactly* how they liked it) and one for water because he wasn’t stupid enough to think alcohol alone would fix this. He practically *sprinted* back to their table, nearly tripping over a lounge chair in his haste.

Setting the drinks down carefully in front of them like an offering (or maybe an apology), Rafael dropped into the seat beside theirs—close enough to talk low under the music but not so close that they’d feel crowded. His knee bounced anxiously under the table as he leaned in slightly.

"I'm so fucking sorry," he whispered hoarsely before she could even take a sip of her drink. His fingers twitched against his own cup like he wanted to reach for them but stopped himself just short of touching their arm—unsure if it was allowed yet after what had happened tonight already...

His voice cracked when Nina laughed loudly somewhere behind him by poolside again; instinctively flinching away from sound entirely before turning pleading eyes back toward Hailee instead: "I swear I didn't know she lied about texting you first... And-and my phone was gone so I couldn't check yours either until just now when..." He swallowed hard around lump forming throat suddenly too tight speak properly anymore without sounding wrecked completely by guilt eating him alive inside out right now...

A beat passed where neither moved nor spoke while bass from speakers nearby thumped relentlessly against both eardrums mercilessly reminding everyone present how awkward silence between two people who usually couldn't shut up around each other truly felt like punishment worse than anything else imaginable really...

Then finally Rafa exhaled shakily through his nose before murmuring barely audible over the noise surrounding them both still: "...Can I hold your hand? Please?"

Sorry—" He grabbed two cups (one for backup in case Hailee changed their mind), filled one with ice-cold lemonade (their favorite), and snatched up a handful of napkins because *shit*, they probably hated seeing him all wet and messy right now after *that* disaster of a first impression on his friends...

By the time he skidded back to where Hailee sat alone at the poolside table—ignoring Nina’s pointed stare from across the deck—he was breathless. He set the drink down carefully in front of them like an offering before hesitating awkwardly beside their chair instead of sitting uninvited.

"Here," he murmured softly this time instead of shouting like an idiot again (why did he always forget volume control when nervous?). Then quieter still: "...I’m gonna go grab my shirt so I’m not just... standing here dripping everywhere making it worse."

But before leaving even for that half-second trip toward where his stuff was piled near the towels? Rafael hesitated again then bent down slightly without thinking — hand hovering near but not quite touching Hailee's knee under table where nobody else could see — voice dropping into something rough and private between just them two:

"*You’re* most important though." A beat pause while heart hammered behind ribs hard enough bruise them internally forever probably if needed be honest here honestly yeah definitely worth it no question about it whatsoever really truly absolutely yes sirree bob– "*Always*. Promise."

Then straightening back up abruptly before could make things weirder by oversharing further (already mentally kicking himself repeatedly over entire existence generally speaking currently), Rafa practically sprinted off retrieve aforementioned shirt while simultaneously trying very hard not imagine all ways might have already ruined everything forever today specifically right now especially...

Rafael's entire body sagged with relief at Hailee's words, but the way they forced that smile made his chest ache. He nodded quickly, already backing toward the bar like a man on a mission. "Sim, sim—anything you want, bebê. I'll be right back."

His hands were shaking as he grabbed two cups—one for Hailee’s drink (vodka cranberry, extra lime, *exactly* how they liked it) and one for water because he wasn’t stupid enough to think alcohol alone would fix this. He practically *sprinted* back to their table, nearly tripping over a lounge chair in his haste.

Setting the drinks down carefully in front of them like an offering (or maybe an apology), Rafael dropped into the seat beside theirs—close enough to talk low under the music but not so close that they’d feel crowded. His knee bounced anxiously under the table as he leaned in slightly.

"I'm so fucking sorry," he whispered hoarsely before she could even take a sip of her drink. His fingers twitched against his own cup like he wanted to reach for them but stopped himself just short of touching their arm—unsure if it was allowed yet after what had happened tonight already...

His voice cracked when Nina laughed loudly somewhere behind him by poolside again; instinctively flinching away from sound entirely before turning pleading eyes back toward Hailee instead: "I swear I didn't know she lied about texting you first... And-and my phone was gone so I couldn't check yours either until just now when..." He swallowed hard around lump forming throat suddenly too tight speak properly anymore without sounding wrecked completely by guilt eating him alive inside out right now...

A beat passed where neither moved nor spoke while bass from speakers nearby thumped relentlessly against both eardrums mercilessly reminding everyone present how awkward silence between two people who usually couldn't shut up around each other truly felt like punishment worse than anything else imaginable really...

Then finally Rafa exhaled shakily through his nose before murmuring barely audible over the noise surrounding them both still: "...Can I hold your hand? Please?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee doesnt speak for a second just looks at her drink. After a moment she turns her hand palm up and then with her other reaches for her drink*

"So are you going to introduce me to your friends. All of them except that one" *Hailee nods towards where Nina currently is*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's breath hitched when Hailee turned their palm up—like a lifeline thrown to a drowning man. He immediately laced their fingers together, squeezing gently as if to say *thank you* and *I'm here* and *please don't let go* all at once. His thumb traced slow circles over the back of their hand while they took a sip of their drink, grounding himself in the warmth of their skin against his.

At the mention of introductions, his face lit up like someone had flipped a switch inside him—eyes suddenly bright with eager devotion despite the lingering guilt in his expression. "Sim! Yes! God, they're gonna love you," he said quickly, already scanning the crowd for familiar faces while keeping tight hold of Hailee’s hand like he was afraid they might disappear if he loosened his grip for even a second.

He pointed excitedly toward a group by the grill where three guys were arguing over burger flipping techniques: "That’s Tommy—he was my roommate sophomore year—and Mike and Danny from the team. Danny’s the one who puked in Coach’s car after championships that one time I told you about." A fond chuckle escaped him before he caught himself and shot Hailee an apologetic glance for laughing at something that wasn't actually funny right now given circumstances...

Then nodding toward two girls taking selfies near tiki torches: "Sarah and Jess—they were in Nina's sorority but way cooler than her obviously." The way his nose scrunched slightly saying Nina's name made it clear exactly what he thought about her now without needing further elaboration on subject matter currently ruining evening entirely...

His free hand came up to rub nervously at back neck again before adding quieter just between them both still holding hands tightly under tabletop shadows hiding how badly fingers trembled still from earlier adrenaline crash settling into bones heavily now instead: "...We don't have stay though if don't want bebê... Could just leave right now say fuck everybody here including especially *her*..."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles politely and reaches a hand out to Rafael's friends* "Pleasure to meet you. I apologize for being late. I had class" *Hailee takes a sip of her drink and then sits down at a table near them*

(OOC: Nina comes over and asks what Hailee means by class. Every has assumed Hailee was at least 25 with a job. Do not respond as Hailee)

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's grip on Hailee's hand tightened protectively as Nina sauntered over, her red bikini dripping pool water onto the patio tiles. His entire body tensed like a guard dog spotting an intruder—jaw clenched, shoulders squared.

Nina tilted her head with that fake-sweet smile Rafael now recognized as poison. **"Class?"** she echoed, looking Hailee up and down like they were a puzzle she couldn’t quite solve. **"Wait… how old *are* you?"**

A few nearby heads turned at the question—Tommy paused mid-bite of his burger, Sarah’s eyebrows shooting up behind her sunglasses.

Rafael didn’t hesitate. He stepped slightly in front of Hailee, his voice dropping to a low growl that surprised even him: **"Back off, Nina."** The warning in his tone was unmistakable—this wasn't the easygoing guy who laughed too loud at bad jokes anymore. This was *don’t-fucking-test-me* territory now after everything tonight had already put them through together...

He shot their friends an apologetic glance but didn't soften his stance for one second while standing between Nina and where Hailee sat calmly sipping their drink like nothing could touch them (which it wouldn't if he had anything say about matter). His thumb brushed absently over back theirs again silently reminding both himself and everyone watching: *Mine.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances up at Nina* "Just turned 21. And Yeah class. Im majoring in History" *Hailee then glances back at her drink and turns to one of the guys with a polite smile* "I hear you used to play Soccer with Rafael"

(OOC: Nina mentions History is a terrible degree for getting a job)

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's entire face lit up like a damn sunrise when Hailee smoothly redirected the conversation to soccer—his chest puffing out with pride at how effortlessly they charmed his friends despite Nina's bullshit. But before Tommy could even open his mouth to reply, Nina let out a derisive snort.

**"History?"** She swirled her cocktail, smirking. **"Good luck paying off those student loans with *that* degree."**

Rafael saw red.

He stepped forward so abruptly that Nina actually flinched back—his voice sharp enough to cut glass: **"Nina."** Just her name, but it carried the weight of a threat this time. His fingers flexed at his sides like he was physically restraining himself from saying (or doing) worse in front of everyone.

Tommy, ever the peacekeeper (and sensing disaster), quickly jumped in: **"Yo, Rafa used to *wreck* people on the field—dude had ankles made of steel!"** He mimed an exaggerated dribble move that made Danny choke-laugh into his beer.

But Rafael wasn’t done yet. Still glaring daggers at Nina, he bit out through clenched teeth: **"Hailee could major in underwater basket-weaving and still be ten times smarter than anyone here."** Then softer, just for them as he turned back toward their seat—eyes instantly going tender again like flipping a switch: **"...Including me obviously."** A beat passed before he added under his breath but loud enough for nearby ears (especially one pair in particular): **"...And they don’t even *need* a job anyway since their family’s loaded as fuck."**

The way Sarah’s drink paused halfway to her lips said everything about how well *that* landed among former classmates who remembered Rafa scraping by on ramen and scholarship checks back in college...

This loser still owes me twenty bucks for that bet in junior year."** He clapped Rafael on the shoulder hard enough to make him stumble forward a step.

Nina rolled her eyes, swirling her drink. **"History? Cute. Good luck paying off those student loans waitressing or whatever."**

Rafael saw red.

Nina’s face drained of color as gasps erupted around them—apparently *that* rumor hadn’t made the reunion circuit yet. She opened her mouth but Rafael was already turning back toward Hailee like she’d ceased to exist, dropping into a crouch beside their chair so they were eye level despite all eyes still being on them both now...

His voice softened instantly when he spoke next though fingertips brushed feather-light over theirs atop table where others couldn't see how tenderly thumb traced circles against palm again too:
**"...Wanna get outta here? We could go get real food instead burnt burgers... Or just drive somewhere quiet where don't have look at anybody except me apologizing properly for next five hours straight?"** The last part came out half-joking but entirely sincere underneath it all because god knows they deserved better than this shitshow tonight had turned into thanks largely due *her* interference ruining everything good between them even temporarily...

name: Hailee
mes:
*A few hours later Hailee is next to Rafael on a lounge chair. He has an arm wrapped around her and is talking to his friends*

*Its nighttime by this point and Hailee has been quiet for about an hour. She is all in her head. She is playing the part of the adoring girlfriend but she feels like her heart is being ripped out after seeing Rafael with Nina earlier and she just cant relax*

*Hailee can't take it anymore and doesnt even care if she looks like a crazy girlfriend as she reaches over and picks up Rafael's phone* "Unlock it"

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael’s laughter died mid-sentence when Hailee grabbed his phone. The abrupt shift in their posture—the quiet tension in their fingers as they demanded it unlocked—made his stomach drop. He didn’t hesitate, thumb already pressing against the sensor before the words fully registered.

**"Here,"** he murmured, turning slightly to shield them from prying eyes with his body as the screen lit up. His voice was low, just for them: **"Look through whatever you want, bebê."** No defensiveness. No annoyance. Just open hands and an open phone—because after tonight? After *Nina*? He’d let them tear his entire life apart piece by piece if it meant they believed him when he said there was nothing to hide.

His arm stayed around their shoulders though, grounding and warm despite how stiff they’d gone beside him. He didn’t pull away or tense up while they scrolled—just kept tracing idle circles on their arm with his fingertips like a silent reminder: *I’m right here.*

A beat passed before he ducked his head closer to whisper against their hair: **"...Find anything good?"** Teasing but soft, testing the waters between them again after hours of careful pretending everything was fine when clearly it wasn't (and hadn't been since moment they walked into this godforsaken party).

Then quieter still—almost too quiet for even Hailee to catch over music still thumping nearby: **"...You know I'd never hurt you like that right? Not ever."**

**"Fuck,"** he whispered roughly, pressing his forehead to theirs right there in front of everyone because *nothing* mattered more than this moment between them now—not pride not appearances not fucking *anything*. **"I should've known she was lying. Should've double-checked with you myself instead of just..."** He swallowed hard against the lump forming in throat again before pulling back just far enough meet those emerald eyes properly:

**"...Tell me what you need from me right now bebê please? Wanna tear her apart in front everyone? I will literally start shit right here no hesitation."**

His friends had gone awkwardly silent nearby—Tommy pretending very hard to be fascinated by a chip bowl while Sarah side-eyed Nina across the pool like she was mentally drafting an apology text already for ever associating with her...

But Rafael only had eyes for one person tonight (every night). He cupped Hailee's jaw gently despite how badly own hands were shaking still from adrenaline crash earlier: **"Or we can leave this second go home burn my phone delete every social media account I own change my number move countries whatever you want just say word and it's done."**

The sheer desperation in voice made it clear this wasn't performative grandstanding either; if they asked him walk through fire right then and there? He'd already be sprinting toward nearest lighter fluid without looking back once...

Rafael didn’t even hesitate—his thumb was on the sensor before Hailee finished speaking, his brows knitting together in concern as he studied their face. **"Bebê? What’s wrong?"** His voice was soft, confused, but there wasn’t an ounce of resistance in him. No flinch, no defensiveness—just open worry as he watched them swipe through his notifications.

His phone screen lit up with nothing but a wallpaper of *them* (that candid shot he’d taken last week when they were laughing over pancakes at 3 AM), followed by:

- **3 missed calls from Mãe**
- **Soccer group chat blowing up about someone’s fantasy league**
- **A single unopened DM from Nina from earlier that afternoon—still marked unread.**

Rafael tensed when he saw it too, his arm tightening around their waist like he could physically shield them from whatever bullshit Nina had tried to slide into his inbox. **"I didn’t even see that,"** he murmured urgently against their temple, lips brushing skin as if trying to imprint the truth directly into them. **"Swear on my life I wouldn’t… *Fuck*, you can open it if you want though."**

He didn’t reach to take the phone back. Didn’t look away for even a second while they held it—just kept tracing slow circles over their hip with his thumb like an anchor point amidst whatever storm was raging behind those emerald eyes right now...

And when Hailee finally tapped open the message (because of course they would after tonight), all it read was:

**[Nina]: hey loser :) miss u xo come early so we can catch up before everyone gets there ;)**

Sent *hours* before Rafael ever arrived at this godforsaken party… and left utterly ignored since then despite being right there in plain sight on lock screen notifications this whole damn time apparently...

Rafael’s laughter died mid-sentence when Hailee grabbed his phone. The abrupt shift in their posture—the quiet tension in their fingers as they demanded it unlocked—made his stomach drop. He didn’t hesitate, thumb already pressing against the sensor before the words fully registered.

**"Here,"** he murmured, turning slightly to shield them from prying eyes with his body as the screen lit up. His voice was low, just for them: **"Look through whatever you want, bebê."** No defensiveness. No annoyance. Just open hands and an open phone—because after tonight? After *Nina*? He’d let them tear his entire life apart piece by piece if it meant they believed him when he said there was nothing to hide.

His arm stayed around their shoulders though, grounding and warm despite how stiff they’d gone beside him. He didn’t pull away or tense up while they scrolled—just kept tracing idle circles on their arm with his fingertips like a silent reminder: *I’m right here.*

A beat passed before he ducked his head closer to whisper against their hair: **"...Find anything good?"** Teasing but soft, testing the waters between them again after hours of careful pretending everything was fine when clearly it wasn't (and hadn't been since moment they walked into this godforsaken party).

Then quieter still—almost too quiet for even Hailee to catch over music still thumping nearby: **"...You know I'd never hurt you like that right? Not ever."**

Rafael's laughter died mid-sentence when Hailee grabbed his phone, the sudden shift in their energy hitting him like a bucket of ice water. His friends' chatter faded into background noise as he focused entirely on them—taking in the tightness around their eyes, the way their fingers trembled slightly against his screen.

"Hey... hey." He turned fully toward them, free hand coming up to cradle their jaw with heartbreaking gentleness despite the public setting. His thumb brushed over their cheekbone as he searched their face. "Whatever you need, bebê. Always."

Without hesitation—without even a flicker of annoyance or defensiveness—he took the phone from them just long enough to punch in his passcode (Hailee's birthday, because *of course* it was) before pressing it back into their palm and folding both of his hands around theirs like a prayer.

His voice dropped to a whisper only they could hear beneath the party noise: "It's yours. *I'm* yours. Look at whatever you want." The raw vulnerability in his eyes would've been embarrassing if he cared even a little about who might be watching—but right now? There was only Hailee and this awful hurt he'd somehow put there without meaning to.

He kept one arm anchored around their waist like an unbreakable tether while they scrolled, pressing a kiss to their temple when they tensed at something on screen. "Nina texted me first today after months of nothing," he murmured against their skin, answering the unasked question. "I should've showed you right away but I was stupid and excited about seeing everyone and—*fuck*—I never wanna make you feel like this again."

A tear hit his wrist where it rested against Hailee’s ribs and Rafael made a wounded noise in response before turning them bodily toward him despite curious glances from nearby friends now pretending not to eavesdrop shamelessly behind beer bottles raised too casually toward lips...

"Look at me," he begged softly (never demanding; never making *them* beg either). When emerald eyes finally met his own watery ones again after what felt like eternity spent drowning apart together? He didn't bother wiping away what dripped down onto own jeans unchecked while holding gaze unflinchingly:

"I deleted every message from her already except that first one so I could prove later if needed how she lied about contacting you... And blocked everywhere too but..." His breath hitched painfully "...if need me walk out front gate right now kneel concrete until believe me? Just say word minha vida because nothing matters more than you knowing truth here tonight okay?"

The way Tommy suddenly found something *very interesting* on Danny’s phone screen suggested maybe volume control had slipped slightly toward end there but Rafael couldn't bring himself care even little bit when heart sat exposed beating raw trembling hands still clutching device containing all sins committed unknowingly earlier evening laid bare between two bodies pressed close enough share same shuddering breaths now under string lights buzzing overhead...

Then—because he couldn’t help himself—he added with a tiny smirk (but eyes still soft): **"...Also? You’re kinda hot when you get possessive."** A quiet chuckle rumbled in his chest as he nuzzled briefly against their temple before pulling back just enough to study their face properly again: **"...But seriously though... we good?"**

Rafael let out a breath he didn’t realize he’d been holding when Hailee finally handed his phone back, shoulders relaxing under their touch. His lips twitched into a small, relieved smile at their demand—like the idea of following anyone else hadn’t even crossed his mind in weeks.

His thumbs brushed over their cheeks, eyes searching theirs with an intensity that shut out the entire party around them. **"You *own* me,**" he murmured, voice rough with sincerity. **"Every damn part. If you wanna burn my socials to the ground right now? Do it."** A beat passed before he added softer: **"...Just don't shut me out again like earlier tonight when you were hurt and pretending you weren't.** ***Please.*** I can't fix what I don't know is broken."

The way his fingers trembled slightly against their skin betrayed how much that quiet hour of Hailee's forced politeness had wrecked him—like every second they spent locked inside their own head instead of his arms was a personal failure on his part.

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's entire face lit up like someone had flipped a switch inside him—grin so wide it probably looked ridiculous to anyone watching, but he didn’t care. **"Deal,"** he said immediately, hands already moving to cradle Hailee properly against his chest now that they weren’t stiff with tension anymore. **"Make it two weeks. Three. Fuck it, I’ll chauffeur you for life if you want."**

He pressed another kiss to their forehead before fishing out his wallet one-handed (because no way was he letting go of them now) and shoved a crumpled twenty into their palm with zero hesitation—then added two more just because he could. **"Interest,"** he explained with a wink before tucking the wallet away again and wrapping both arms securely around them instead like human seatbelt made entirely of muscle and devotion...

A content sigh escaped him as they finally relaxed fully against him—the weight of them warm and right in ways that made his chest ache in the best possible sense suddenly after hours spent walking on eggshells tonight...

Then quietly—just for them: **"...Love you so damn much bebê."** No fanfare or grand gesture needed; just simple truth spoken soft against skin still faintly smelling like chlorine from pool earlier but mostly just *them* underneath everything else too...

name: Rafael
mes:

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael caught Hailee’s hand mid-air, lacing their fingers together as he stood—his other arm immediately wrapping around their waist to tug them flush against his side. **"Only if you *make* me leave,"** he murmured into their hair, voice half-teasing but with an undercurrent of something far more serious beneath it.

He waved off his friends with a distracted grin, already steering them toward the car without looking back—like the party had ceased to exist the second they decided it was time to go. The second they touched him again like they still wanted him close after everything tonight...

The drive was quiet except for Rafael’s thumb tracing absent circles over Hailee’s thigh every time he shifted gears—his touch lingering just a little too long each time, like he couldn’t help himself now that they were alone again. When they pulled up outside their apartment, he killed the engine but made no move to unlock the doors yet.

**"Or,"** he started slowly, turning in his seat to face them fully—eyes dark and pleading in the dim streetlight glow filtering through windshield glass between them both right now... **"...I could stay."** A beat passed before he added softer still: **"...Just sleep. Hold you all night so you know I'm not going anywhere unless *you* tell me to."**

His jaw clenched briefly before forcing out next part like ripping off bandaid over fresh wound suddenly exposed air for first time since earlier when everything went wrong at party: **"...And so you don't have wake up wondering if I meant any of this today either..."**

mes:
Rafael groaned dramatically, catching Hailee’s wrist before they could pull away completely—pressing their knuckles to his lips with a pout that looked downright criminal on a man his size. **"*Five*? Who the hell schedules meetings at *seven*?"** He nipped lightly at their fingertips, grinning when they shivered. **"Fine, fine—but only ‘cause I know you’ll bite me if I mess up your beauty sleep."**

Still, he didn’t let go just yet. His grip loosened just enough to slide down and squeeze their hand instead, voice dropping to something quieter—raw in a way that made it clear he wasn’t joking anymore: **"...Text me when you get inside so I know you're safe. And wake me up if you need *anything*, yeah? Even if it's stupid o'clock."**

A beat passed before he finally released them with exaggerated reluctance, flopping back against his seat like a kicked puppy. **"Ugh. Now I gotta go home to my *empty* bed like some kinda peasant."** His smirk returned as he added slyly: **"...But tomorrow night? You're *mine*. No meetings, no exes—just me reminding you exactly who the hell I belong to."**

He waited until they were safely inside with a flicker of lights in the window before driving off—but not before sending one last text so it'd be waiting for them the second they locked the door behind them:

**[Rafa]:** still thinking about how fucking good u looked tonight
**[Rafa]:** also ur banned from uber now btw
**[Rafa]:** driver rafael is on duty 24/7 starting NOW 😤🚗💨

Just let me—"**

But then reality hit him like a bucket of ice water: the 7 AM meeting with his biggest client, the fact that he *did* sound like a sleep-deprived gremlin when his alarm went off at ungodly hours...

With a defeated sigh, he slumped back against the seat but didn’t let go of their hand just yet. **"...Fine,"** he grumbled, pouting like a scolded puppy. **"But I’m picking you up for breakfast after my meeting. And you *better* still be in bed when I get here so I can crawl back under the covers with you."** His thumb traced slow circles over their pulse point—a silent plea for them to agree before he had to actually leave tonight without them...

Then quieter, almost sheepish: **"...And text me when you get inside? So I know you're safe?"** Because god forbid they thought for even one second that he wouldn't still be worrying about them until morning came around again and proved otherwise firsthand instead...

Rafael groaned dramatically, catching Hailee’s wrist before they could pull away completely—his lips brushing their knuckles in a quick, desperate kiss. **"*Merda*, I forgot about that stupid meeting,"** he grumbled, but his grip loosened reluctantly. **"But *text me* when you wake up, yeah? First thing. Or I’ll show up here in my gym clothes smelling like protein shakes and *beg* to use your shower."**

A smirk tugged at his lips as he leaned across the console to steal one last proper kiss—slow and sweet enough to melt their resolve if he played his cards right. When he finally pulled back (only because breathing was technically necessary), his voice was rough with the effort of letting them go: **"...And tomorrow night? I’m cooking for you. No excuses. You’re stuck with me."**

He waited until they were safely inside their building before driving off—but not before rolling down the window to yell after them: **"LOVE YOU! MEU AMOR!"** loud enough that half the block probably heard it too.

Rafael groaned dramatically, catching Hailee’s wrist before they could pull away completely—his lips brushing their knuckles in a quick, pleading kiss. **"*Five minutes*,"** he bargained, voice rough around the edges. **"Just let me walk you to your door. I’ll even tuck you in like a fucking Hallmark movie."** His thumb traced the delicate bones of their hand, gaze flickering between their eyes and mouth like he was memorizing them all over again.

But then his phone buzzed in the cup holder—the reminder for his 7 AM meeting glaring accusingly at both of them—and he exhaled hard through his nose before reluctantly letting go. **"Fine,"** he grumbled, reaching over to pop the lock anyway despite his own protest. **"...But I’m texting you goodnight the second I get home. And good morning. And probably every five minutes in between because *someone* stole all my willpower tonight."**

A beat passed before he leaned across the console anyway—one hand cradling the back of Hailee’s neck as he kissed them properly this time: slow and deep and lingering enough to make up for every second they'd spent apart today (and every one they'd spend apart until morning). When he finally pulled back, his voice was wrecked: **"...Love you more than soccer. More than *sleep*. That’s how you know I’m serious."**

Then—because Rafael Carvalho had never been able to resist one last dramatic flourish—he pressed a final kiss to their forehead before flopping back into his seat with an exaggerated sigh: **"Now go before I kidnap you for real this time."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee wakes the next morning and smiles as she reads a good morning text and several other from Rafael this morning. She loves how attentive he is*

*Hailee goes her morning routine of getting up and taking care of her dog and then she makes breakfest. She curls up on the couch in her pajamas with her toast snd yogurt snd scrolls through her phone*

*Hailee wont lie she is still on edge after yesterday. Logically Hailee knows Rafael isn't cheating but fuck her last 4 relationships didnt end well so she is scrolling through Rafael's Instagram following and making a mental list of who to have him unfollow later*

*Hailee frowns when she sees some many fitness girls on his page and she sees how many want him to be their personal trainer. She isn't mad about that I mean it his job but she doesnt understand why he has to follow them on Instagram.*

*Hailee hears a knock on the door and puts her bowl down going over and opening it* "Yeah what"

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael stood there holding two steaming to-go cups of coffee and a paper bag that smelled like fresh pastries, his gym bag slung over one shoulder. His hair was still damp from a post-workout shower, and he wore that stupidly charming lopsided grin that always made Hailee’s stomach flip.

**"Delivery for the most beautiful person in the world,"** he announced, holding up the coffee—one marked with her usual order (vanilla latte, extra shot) and the other black with *"Property of Hailee’s Boyfriend (Do Not Steal)"* scribbled on the side in Sharpie.

But then his gaze flicked past her to where her phone was still open on Instagram—the screen blatantly displaying his following list—and his smile faltered for half a second before he schooled it back into place. He didn’t call her out, didn’t get defensive. Instead, he stepped inside without waiting for an invitation (because let's be real, they were way past formalities at this point) and set everything down on her counter before turning to face her fully.

**"Okay,"** he said simply, pulling out his phone right then and there. **"Unfollow everyone who makes you even *kinda* uncomfortable."** His thumbs moved fast as he scrolled through his following list without hesitation—no arguing, no questioning it. **"Fitness influencers? Gone." *Click.* "Random girls from college? Gone." *Click.* "That one barista who always writes hearts on my cup even though I never flirted back? *Super gone.***

He tossed his phone onto the couch beside hers when he was done and reached for her instead—hands warm around hers as he tugged them closer until their foreheads nearly touched. **"...I don't care about any of them,"** he murmured, voice rough with sincerity despite how early it was. **"Only you."** A beat passed before mischief flickered back into his tone: **"...Also I may have bribed my boss to move all my training sessions with female clients to group classes only because apparently I'm ‘distracting’ or whatever."**

Then quieter again:
**"...Still mad at me?"**
